intro: Actinomeris heterophylla, commonly known as the variable leaf liverwort, is a type of non-vascular plant belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its diverse leaf morphology, which can vary significantly depending on environmental conditions. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its leaves are usually arranged in a rosette or decumbent form, and they may exhibit different shapes and sizes along the same plant. Actinomeris heterophylla plays a role in soil stabilization and provides microhabitats for various small organisms.
